go_data.justification: Rab proteins act as membrane-bound molecular switches cycling between an inactive GDP-bound form and an active GTP-bound form.
Small guanosine triphosphatases of the Rab family regulate intracellular vesicular trafficking.
Through their effectors, Rab GTPases regulate actin and microtubule-dependent transport, vesicle budding and tethering, and membrane fusion.
Through their effectors, Rab GTPases regulate actin and microtubule-dependent transport, vesicle budding and tethering, and membrane fusion.
Rab proteins act as membrane-bound molecular switches cycling between an inactive GDP-bound form and an active GTP-bound form.
